creditline: The Clarence H. White Collection, assembled and organized by Professor Clarence H. White Jr., and given in memory of Lewis F. White, Dr. Maynard P. White Sr., and Clarence H. White Jr., the sons of Clarence H. White Sr. and Jane Felix White

texts.textentryhtml:
Created by Thomas M. Edmiston, the artist. Acquired by Clarence H. White Sr., between ca. 1899 and July 7, 1925; by descent to Clarence H. White Jr., on or after July 8, 1925 [1]; by descent to Clarence H. White Jr.’s widow, Ruth Royer White, 1978 [2]; bequest, to Princeton University Art Museum, 1983 [3].

Notes:

[1]. Possibly on the occasion of Clarence H. White Sr.’s death, as part of the Clarence H. White Collection.
[2]. On the occasion of Clarence H. White Jr.’s death.
[3]. Carried out by Ruth Royer White on behalf of Clarence H. White Jr.
texts.remarks: as per research by Grace Xiao & Cecilia Moore - Summer 2024

bibliography.boilertext: Anne McCauley, Clarence H. White and His World: The Art and Craft of Photography 1895–1925 (Yale University Press: New Haven and London, 2017)
bibliography.citation: Anne McCauley, Clarence H. White and His World: The Art and Craft of Photography 1895–1925 (Yale University Press: New Haven and London, 2017), p. 34

bibliography.boilertext: "Portfolio of Photography by Other Artists in the Clarence H. White Collection," in "The Art of Pictoral Photography 1890-1925," special issue, Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 51, no. 2 (1992): 39–78.
bibliography.citation: "Portfolio of Photography by Other Artists in the Clarence H. White Collection," in "The Art of Pictoral Photography 1890-1925," special issue, Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 51, no. 2 (1992): 39–78., p. 55 (illus.)

exhibitions.citation: Clarence H. White and His World: The Art and Craft of Photography, 1895-1925 (Saturday, October 07, 2017 - Sunday, January 07, 2018)
